nodes.html: Aims & Scope

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Aims & Scope

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Event Management is the leading peer-reviewed international journal for the study and analysis of events and festivals, meeting the research and educational needs of this rapidly growing industry for more than 20 years.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Event Management

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: We:

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: <ul>

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • Publish high-quality interdisciplinary event studies work and therefore promote a broad spectrum of theoretical perspectives from management and organizational studies to sociology and social science.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: event studies

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • Encourage the study of all kinds of physical, digital, and hybrid events from small- to large-scale cultural and sporting events, festivals, meetings, conventions, exhibitions, to expositions, across a range of geographical and cultural contexts.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • Actively support authors to take a critical perspective concerning the power and potential of events as a force for social, economic, and environmental good, while challenging where events can do better and make a positive contribution to society.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: <li>

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: <li>

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Event Management

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: We offer authors four routes to publication, with simple submission guideline (see “Submission guidelines” tab).

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: <ul>

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • Research article – a traditional submission route of up to 10,000 words focused on contributing to theory.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Research article

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • Research note – a short note of up to 2,000 words focused on providing novel and/or innovative insights to contribute to our body of theory and/or empirical knowledge. These can also include debates and/or commentaries.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Research note

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • Event case study – a new route of up to 10,000 words providing in-depth empirical insights and application of existing theoretical ideas to a specific event or series of events.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Event case study

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • Event education – a new route of up to 10,000 words providing in-depth insights into events-related education policy and/or practice for colleagues to support high-quality international learning and teaching experiences.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Event education

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Event Management

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Editorial board

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Our double-blind peer review process is rigorous and supportive.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: STEP 1: All manuscripts submitted to Event Management will go through a rigorous screening process by either the Editor-in-Chief or Deputy Editors to be desk rejected or progressed to one of 40+ Associate Editors who handle the review process.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Event Management

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: STEP 3: Toward the end of peer review the Associate Editor recommends a final decision to the Editor-in-Chief or Deputy Editor who makes the final decision and provides final constructive feedback where appropriate.
